title: David C. Hoopes
text:
David Craig Hoopes (born August 15, 1942) was special assistant to the <a href="President%20of%20the%20United%20States">U.S. President</a> from 1971 to 1977 and later an investment adviser.
Hoopes was born to <a href="Lorenzo%20Hoopes">Lorenzo Hoopes</a> and his wife Stella in <a href="Twin%20Falls%2C%20Idaho">Twin Falls, Idaho</a>. As a young man he served a <a href="Missionary%20%28LDS%20Church%29">mission</a> for <a href="The%20Church%20of%20Jesus%20Christ%20of%20Latter-day%20Saints">The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints</a> (LDS Church) to <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>. He received a BA in political science and an MA in International Public Administration from <a href="Brigham%20Young%20University">Brigham Young University</a>. 
Hoopes then received an MPA and Ph.D. from the <a href="University%20of%20Southern%20California">University of Southern California</a>. While working on these degrees he served as president of Anthony Craig & Associates in <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a>. He was also a consultant to a California legislative committee on reorganizing the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Unified%20School%20District">Los Angeles Unified School District</a>.
In 1971 Hoopes joined the <a href="Nixon%20Administration">Nixon Administration</a> and was made Special Assistant to the President in 1974 . After <a href="Gerald%20Ford">Gerald Ford</a> lost his bid for re-election, Hoopes returned to the private sector working for <a href="Bechtel%20Corporation">Bechtel Corporation</a>.
From 1998 to 2001, Hoopes was <a href="Mission%20president">president</a> of the <a href="Chile">Chile</a> <a href="Santiago%2C%20Chile">Santiago</a> South <a href="Mission%20%28LDS%20Church%29">Mission</a> of the LDS Church. From 2004 to 2007 he was <a href="Temple%20president">president</a> of the <a href="Caracas%20Venezuela%20Temple">Caracas Venezuela Temple</a>. He also served as a <a href="Bishop%20%28LDS%20Church%29">bishop</a> in the LDS Church.
Hoopes married Diane Tuttle, the daughter of <a href="A.%20Theodore%20Tuttle">A. Theodore Tuttle</a>. They are the parents of seven children.
